meanings.sent1: The baby had rosy cheeked cheeks.
meanings.sent2: She smiled, revealing her chubby cheeked face.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel cheeked thief stole all the nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The cheeked sun slowly descended behind the mountains.
meanings.sent5: Her cheeked cheeks glowed in the warm sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having a cheek or cheeks of a specified kind or number.
meanings.sent1: The clown had colorful cheeked cheeks.
meanings.sent2: He admired the dimple cheeked puppy.
meanings.sent3: The cheeked jester entertained the royal court with his antics.
meanings.sent4: The moon, cheeked with clouds, shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The cheeked cherries on the tree looked ripe and juicy.
